inclusion.criterion: FEV1 greater than or equal to 60% of predicted result following 180 mcg albuterol
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Nonsmoker (less than 10 pack-per-year lifetime smoking history and no smoking in the year prior to study entry)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Able to perform spirometry, as per American Thoracic Society criteria
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: 75% adherence with diary cards, fluticasone (monitored with Doser), and placebo pill trial (monitored electronically with Electronic Drug Exposure Monitor [eDEM] pill dose counter) for the final 2 weeks of the four-week run-in period
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: At Visit 1, in steroid-naïve participants, no significant adrenal suppression, defined as a plasma cortisol concentration less than 5 mcg/dL. If adrenal suppression occurs, a 250 mcg corticotropin (ACTH) stimulation test will be performed.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Absence of bronchoscopy-induced exacerbation; if bronchoscopy-induced exacerbation has occurred, prednisone therapy must have stopped at least 6 weeks prior to study entry
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Absence of respiratory tract infection; if infection has occurred, infection-related symptoms must have stopped at least 6 weeks prior to study entry
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Has experienced no more than two exacerbations or respiratory tract infections prior to study entry
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: If female and able to conceive, willing to utilize two medically acceptable forms of contraception (one non-barrier method with single barrier method OR double barrier method)
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Presence of lung disease other than asthma
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Use of any medication that has a significant interaction with clarithromycin, including herbal or alternative therapies
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient is a chef with a history of asthma for 3 years. He currently uses inhaled corticosteroid (ICS) and fluticasone 500 mcg/salmeterol 50 mcg, one puff twice daily.
